qas.question: What state has the oldest capital building used continuously since it was built?
What architectural style was used to design the Virginia State Capitol?
What notable federal government buildings were designed in the neoclassical style?
What is the architectural style of the 1845 Egyptian Building?
Who were the designers of the Virginia State Capitol?

context: Architectural classicism is heavily represented in all districts of the city, particularly in Downtown, the Fan, and the Museum District. Several notable classical architects have designed buildings in Richmond. The Virginia State Capitol was designed by <a4_0>Thomas Jefferson and Charles-Louis Clérisseau<a4_0/> in 1785. It is the second-oldest US statehouse in continuous use (after <a0_0>Maryland<a0_0/>'s) and was the first US government building built in the <a1_0>neo-classical<a1_0/> style of architecture, setting the trend for other state houses and the federal government buildings (including the <a2_0>White House and The Capitol<a2_0/>) in Washington, D.C. Robert Mills designed Monumental Church on Broad Street. Adjoining it is the 1845 Egyptian Building, one of the few <a3_0>Egyptian Revival<a3_0/> buildings in the United States.
